title: Ask HN: Are Generated Passphrases Safe?
text:
I'm currently migrating from LastPass to Bitwarden. As part of the process, I'm updating a bunch of passwords. Bitwarden's generator can create random passphrases like the following:

spiny approval avalanche uncouth tattoo

Are these generated passphrases suitable for use on more sensitive accounts? I'm currently using generated passwords with numbers and symbols (20+ characters) but this can be a bit of a pain when I need to input a password using my TV remote or dictate it to my partner. I don't have a great sense for what's easily crackable so it would be great to get some opinions from those more familiar with the cryptography space.

Anonymous Messenger
text:
Hello everyone, I am looking for the most anonymous messaging app between friends. Such an application where even the police or hackers will never find what I wrote. For example, like Threema, but I'm looking for something that's free.

Briar, Matrix, Cwtch, Signal, Session, there are many, but which one is the best? I want to protect my privacy and I want my private messages to never be seen or recovered by anyone.

Ask HN: Great internship at shitty loc
text:
I am studying chemical engineering in my masters and am currently on the hunt for an internship next semester. I am located in Switzerland/Germany and right now have offers from two big chemical companies (BASF, Bayer).

Here is the thing. The one that interests me the most, is in a horrible location. I would have to relocate (that's OK with me), but there is also nothing, no bigger city or so, in a 100 km radius. However, the topic really resonates with my current interests. It's about utilizing black box ML to optimize plant performance. Since I have been exploring CS/programming a lot lately, this would potentially be a great fit. The other one is in a better location (would still have to relocate), but the topic sounds a bit off (no real connection to ChemE).

Both internships would be for 3–4 months. How would you approach this situation? I am not really hyped to spend the entire summer at some remote plant just working my ass off. Would you take one of the offers, or wait until something else might come around? Any other tips/insights?
